medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset right upper quadrant (RUQ) abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely 2 hours prior to presentation after a heavy pasta dinner. This is the patient's fourth episode of acute RUQ pain, with the first two episodes being self-limited and lasting only a few minutes. The third episode occurred approximately 2 weeks ago, accompanied by RUQ pain, leukocytosis, and 9mm CBD with cholelithiasis. Pain was associated with nausea and one episode of vomiting. Symptoms resolved by the time the patient arrived at the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes G1P1 and required operating room intervention post-delivery for retained placenta.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of hypertension (HTN); father has a history of diabetes mellitus (DM).
